name: 陳岡伯
objective:
本課程主要在培養各類型段落、短文的撰寫能力，包括描寫、敘述、說明及議論性質文章。
This course is intended for university-level EFL writing students with the aim of increasing their fluency in English writing. To achieve this goal, students in this course read various kinds of articles and formulate their own critical thinking. With the experience of critical reading and thinking, students will develop their own writing strategies and write three short critical essays (500-800 words) with different rhetorical modes: comparison-contrast, cause-and-effect, and argumentative. 
     Basic knowledge and skills of conducting research will be integrated into the course; students will learn how to search for relevant sources, adopt proper academic styles, and avoid plagiarism. Towards the end of the semester, students will decide a research topic and write a research proposal and working bibliography to prepare for the longer researched essay (1500-2000 words) in the spring term.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to the course

Week 2: Review the organization of an essay: introduction, body paragraphs and conclusion
              Review the concepts of unity and coherence

Week 3: Quiz 1: unity and coherence
              Review language and grammar: clauses and run-on sentence and fragment 

Week 4: Discuss the article and Exercises 3 and 4 (EAW 39)
             Activity: freewriting of comparison and contrast
             Lecture: comparison and contrast essay: signal words and organization

Week 5: Quiz 2: clauses and run-on sentence
              Discuss the article and Exercises 8 (EAW 50)
              Discuss students’ topic and thesis statement
              Review language and grammar: relative clauses

Week 6: Discuss the article "Two Ways of Viewing the River” (handout)
              Discuss students’ outlines
             Introduction to academic styles

Week 7: Quiz 3: relative clauses
              Peer review: how to use track changes and annotation on Word
              Lecture: cause-and-effect essay
             Quotation: MLA style

Week 8: Discuss the article and exercise 2 (EAW 88)
              Works Cited: MLA style
              Review language and grammar: cause connectors and effect connectors

Week 9: Mid-term exam

Week 10: Discuss the article “Some Lessons from the Assembly Line” (handout) and exercises 
               Discuss students’ topics and thesis statements
               Review language and grammar: conditional sentences

Week 11: Discuss the mid-term exam
               Discuss students’ outlines
               Lecture: argumentative essay
              Quiz 4: conditional sentences

Week 12: discuss the article and Exercise 11 (EAW 117-118)
               Effective summary (EAW 114)
              Rhetorical focus (EAW 124)
              Review language and grammar: connectors (EAW 126)

Week 13: Discuss the article “Judging by the Cover” (handout)
               Quiz 5: connectors
              Review language and grammar: clauses

Week 14: Discuss students’ topics and thesis statements
                Review language and grammar: gerund and infinitives

Week 15: Discuss students’ outline
                Discuss the article “Rethinking the Voting Age” (handout)
               Quiz 6: gerunds and infinitives

Week 16: Review language and grammar: passives
               Rhetorical focus: literary present
               How to write a research proposal

Week 17: Discuss the article “Harry Potter Casts His Spell in the Classroom” (handout)
                Discuss the students’ topics
                Research topic, the problematic, methodology, literature review
scorePolicy:
Class attendance and participation (in-class exercises): 10%
6 quizzes: 20%
Midterm exam: 20%
3 short essays and 1 research proposal: 40%
Peer-reviews: 10%
materials:
Liss, Rhonda and Jason Davis. Effective Academic Writing 3: The Research Essay. Oxford UP, 2012.

MLA Handbook, 8th Edition. The Modern Language Association of America, 2017. (Recommended)
